body_html:
Indeed, I didn't come up with the name :) By Spatial, Eigen refers to 'planes, rows, columns', with 'depth' not being part of the spatial dimension, based on the API.

Edit: presumably this naming comes as an extension of 2D pooling on images, which treats height and width of an image as 'spatial'. The number of channels / depth of an image isn't really 'spatial' in the same way the x/y coordinators of an image are.

body:
Indeed, I didn't come up with the name :) By Spatial, Eigen refers to 'planes, rows, columns', with 'depth' not being part of the spatial dimension, based on the API.

Edit: presumably this naming comes as an extension of 2D pooling on images, which treats height and width of an image as 'spatial'.  The number of channels / depth of an image isn't really 'spatial' in the same way the x/y coordinators of an image are.
